list_definition.definition: something (bought, kept or given) which reminds one of a place, person or occasion

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I bought the statue as a souvenir of our holiday in Greece.

list_ex_of_english: Representative items, such as statues, monuments, souvenirs, and literature indicated that activists intended to popularize the martyrdom for their own purposes.
Newly married, he misses his wife, and despatches a message to her, asking for a souvenir which he could take into battle.
The design of souvenirs is a matter for the manufac- turers.
The success of souvenir sales and the location of the shop have led to continual overcrowding and lack of space for stock.
Tourists, who presumably are looking for those souvenirs, were only referred to twice in street contexts.
A small museum as well as a snack bar, a restaurant, and a souvenir shop were built in the vicinity of the attraction.
These souvenirs manifested women's personal pasts, not a mythic national past.
It has not been possible to confirm that imported souvenirs have been sold, but the concessionaires are being reminded of the conditions of their contract.
